quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Wine and Toy
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, process, grape. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the nationality of Erno Rubik, the inventor of the 3-D mechanical puzzle, known as the Rubiks Cube?
This type of grape, native to Europe, was devastated by a pest in the middle 1800s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: vitis vinifera

questions.question: What plastic toy, invented by George Lerner in 1949, has the distinction of being the first toy advertised on television?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Potato Head

questions.question: Which of these toys is seen in Chandler and Joeys apartment on the TV show Friends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Magna Doodle

questions.question: Used to measure the concentration of sugar in wine, this scale was developed by a French pharmacist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: baume scale

questions.question: What science deals with fermentation?
This substance is a product of volcanic activity and is used as preservative in wine making.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sulfur dioxide

questions.question: What term is used to denote a trained and knowledgeable wine professional?
The Teddy Bear was named in honor of President Theodore Roosevelt, who refused to shoot a bear while on a hunting trip in this state.
This term denotes the process of adding sugar to the must, the juice of the freshly pressed grapes, in order to increase alcohol content in wine.
Which word refers to the water soluble pigments that give wine its red color?
This is a mixture of red and white sparkling wine, that has a high sugar content.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cold Duck

questions.question: What is the name of the beneficial mold that develops on grapes under moist conditions and leaves grape crops partially raisined?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: noble rot

questions.question: What science studies all aspects of wine and wine making?
What toy did Apollo 8 astronauts carry into space in 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silly Putty

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Ingredient and Syrup
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, algae, agents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This agent was patented by LOreal.  It is stated to be the only sure UVA sun filter as its molecule remains unaffected by solar energy. Thus, it provides effective and long-lasting sun protection.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mexoryl SX

questions.question: Canada is by far the worlds largest maple syrup producer. Approximately what part of the worlds maple syrup is produced in Canada?
This ingredient is often used in anti-cellulite lotions and slim gels because it enhances the micro-circulation and easily dissolves body fat.
These agents are used to transport active ingredients through the skin and take them where they would be most effective.
These substances are added to lotions and creams because they smooth and soften the skin.  There are several hundred different kinds.
This component produces adenosinetriphosphate, which increases the cells vitality and enables the body to release quick burst of energy.
These substances act as moisturisers by attracting water to themselves, even from the air.  They are also used to prevent creams from drying out.
It takes 40 litres (10 gallons) of maple sap to make 2 litres (a half gallon) of maple syrup.
After 10 years of research LOreal found this molecule, which effectively stops hair loss.
Which of these is not a term used for the building in which maple syrup is boiled?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sugar Barn

questions.question: This ingredient is used in a lot of cosmetic products.  It is rich in micro-elements and minerals because it comes from the depths of the sea.  It has been said that this ingredient can activate the chemical process typical for youthful skin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl powder

questions.question: This coenzyme is naturally produced by a specific algae.  It is used for transforming food into energy that the body will use to perform all its activities.  It is also a powerful antioxidant.
Sugar on snow is a popular New England treat. It is boiled maple syrup cooled in snow and placed on sticks. Which food item is not traditionally served with this candy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shortbread cookies

questions.question: The production of maple syrup traditionally starts in what month?

This is a protein complex produced by the bacterium, Clostridium botulinum.  It contains a toxin that causes food poisoning.  However, when injected in small doses it smoothens existing lines and wrinkles.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Bread and Usa
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, gustav, ale. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bread is one of the oldest prepared foods.
In mediaeval England, what was an ale-connor?

options.text: An unscrupulous merchant who sold muddy water flavoured with hops

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A beer-tester

questions.question: When was Wonder Bread  first marketed in the USA as pre-sliced bread?
How old must a tree be before it can be tapped for maple syrup production?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 40 years old

questions.question: What is the name of the oldest brewery in the USA that is still operating?
When was the first loaf of sliced bread sold?
During the years of the Civil War molasses was made using maple syrup because it did not require slave labor.
Approximately how many commercial maple syrup producers are there in North America?
India Pale Ale was originally made in India.
Who prompted the marketing of sliced bread in 1928?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: W.E. Long

questions.question: The bread-slicing machine was first commercially used by the Chillicothe Baking Company of Chillicothe, Missouri.
Which state produces the most maple syrup in New England?
Gustav Papendick bought the second bread-slicer.
What happened to the first prototype of the bread-slicing machine?

options.text: It was destroyed by its inventor.
It was stolen by the people of Battle Creek, Michigan.
It was destroyed in a fire.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was destroyed in a fire.

questions.question: The worlds strongest lager is named after Santa Claus.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Dish and Delicacy
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, brine, endgame. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: First you catch herring, then gut them, and can them in brine. Next you leave them in a warm place for several months. When you see the middle of the can swell you open the can under water and put them on a plate or bowl and serve. What is this dish called?
Which of these is not the equivalent of what Americans often call head cheese?

This is an Italian delicacy consisting of raw beef, tuna or veal that has been pounded and cut into very thin slices. It is served with a mustard sauce and is usually placed on a bed of arugula and green with an olive oil/lemon juice dressing.
A rook is worth more than a bishop.
Which of these descriptions best describes the Scottish product Irn -Bru?

options.text: A lamb dish that contains raisins, barley, hops, and cherries
A very strong breakfast tea that is brewed from tea leaves, barley, and seaweed
A type of dessert that is made from an orange marmalade/barley mixture
An orange colored soft drink that contains ammonium ferric citrate and quinnine

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An orange colored soft drink that contains ammonium ferric citrate and quinnine

questions.question: First corn is usually attacked by a parasitic fungal infestation. The kernels swell to as much as 9 times normal size, and then darken. They are collected, canned, and sold to the public as a delicacy. Which one of these is NOT a name for this food?
This is a Japanese dish made from thinly sliced, pickled ginger which is kept in a solution of sugar and water.
The winner of a chess game is usually the player who made the penultimate mistake.
The optimal position for a knight is the edge of the chess board.
This food was not on the Sopranos, but is a Taiwanese dish.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bao Bing

questions.question: Americas entry into World War Two led to a ban on sliced bread starting in August 1943.
In chess, the king should be used aggressively in the endgame.
The phase Greatest thing since sliced bread derived from a Wonder Bread advertising campaign.
Which of these is the name of a Danish delicacy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yule Brod

questions.question: Which of these is a traditional Japanese breakfast dish?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Chess and Carrot
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, festival, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is a combination in chess?

options.text: A sequence of moves leading to zugzwang
A sequence of moves leading to an advantage
A sequence of moves leading to checkmate
A sequence of moves involving a sacrifice

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A sequence of moves leading to an advantage

questions.question: Which vitamin is the orange pigment beta-carotene converted to by the human body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin A

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of underpromotion in chess?

options.text: Telling your opponent you are a duffer when you are really an expert
Taking your opponents pawn with your knight instead of your queen
Converting your pawn into a knight

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Converting your pawn into a knight

questions.question: In chess a backwards move is almost always a bad move.
Parsley is a close relative of the carrot
Which of the following is usually a disadvantage in chess?

options.text: A castled king in the opening
A centralized king in the ending

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An isolated pawn

questions.question: The loss of a single pawn is not enough to lose a chess game.
As well as oranges, carrots come in white and pink varieties.
Carrot tops are poisonous to humans, even in small quantities.
Which US state hosts a carrot festival in the town that calls itself Carrot Capital of the World?
What is the scientific (Latin) name of the wild carrot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daucus carota

questions.question: The carrot is thought to have originated from this country.
What does the chess term zugzwang mean?

options.text: Being almost out of time on your clock
Being unable to move without making your position worse than it already is

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Being unable to move without making your position worse than it already is

questions.question: Eating carrots can improve a persons night vision.
The carrot was outlawed in Holland in the 16th century.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Champagne and Process
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, developed, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which process involves rotating of champagne bottles and gradually moving them to a neck-down orientation?
Which of these words is not a term referring to sparkling wine?

options.text: All of these refer to sparkling wine.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these refer to sparkling wine.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a grape variety used for producing Champagne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cabernet Franc

questions.question: When was Pepsi first made?
Who directed the movie Champagne, which tells the story of a young woman forced to get a job after her father tells her he has lost all his money?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alfred Hitchcock

questions.question: Champagne is usually served in a champagne flute at what temperature?
Which of these remarks about Champagne was made by Sir Winston Churchill in 1918?

options.text: Gentlemen, in the little moment that remains to us between the crisis and the catastrophe, we may as well drink a glass of champagne.
Remember gentlemen, it’s not just France we are fighting for, it’s Champagne!
In victory, you deserve Champagne, in defeat, you need it.
Some people wanted Champagne and caviar when they should have had beer and hot dogs.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Remember gentlemen, it’s not just France we are fighting for, it’s Champagne!

questions.question: Which country had the highest production of carrots in 2005?
Which Champagne, featured in at least eight Bond movies, does fictional spy James Bond prefer?
According to her biography, this Hollywood actress once took a bath in 350 bottles of Champagne.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marilyn Monroe

questions.question: In the mid 1980s Dr. Pepper became exclusively a product of the Coca Cola Company.
What year was Coca-Cola developed?
Which of these cocktails includes the following ingredients: Champagne, cognac, raspberry liqueur, lemon juice and fresh raspberries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose of the Ritz

questions.question: Is it true that root beer comes in two forms: alcoholic and soft drink?
Which British band performed the song Champagne Supernova that was included in the album (Whats the Story) Morning Glory?
